SEARCH
Package com.syncura360.controller

Class DrugController

java.lang.Object
com.syncura360.controller.DrugController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @RequestMapping("/drug") public class DrugController extends Object
Controller for managing drugs in the inventory. Handles operations for inserting, editing, deleting, and viewing drug information.
Author:
Darsh-KP

    • DrugController

      public DrugController(JwtUtil jwtUtil, DrugService drugService)
      Constructor for initializing DrugController with required dependencies. Uses constructor injection for necessary components.
      Parameters:
      jwtUtil - Used to access jwt claims.
      drugService - The service layer used for performing operations related to drugs.

  • Method Details

    • addDrug

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GenericMessageResponseDTO> addDrug(@RequestHeader(name="Authorization") String authorization, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid DrugFormDTO drugFormDTO, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
      Processes the HTTP request to add a new drug in the system. Validates drug data, and stores it in the database.
      Parameters:
      authorization - The authorization token used to identify user making the request.
      drugFormDTO - DTO containing the details of the drug to be added.
      bindingResult - Holds the results of the validation of the DrugFormDTO. This allows for checking if the data is valid before proceeding.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a GenericMessageResponseDTO that indicated whether the drug was successfully added or if an error occurred.

    • modifyDrug

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GenericMessageResponseDTO> modifyDrug(@RequestHeader(name="Authorization") String authorization, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid DrugUpdateDTO drugUpdateDTO, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
      Processes the HTTP request to update an existing drug in the system. Validates drug data, and updates it in the database.
      Parameters:
      authorization - The authorization token used to identify user making the request.
      drugUpdateDTO - DTO containing the details of the drug to be updated.
      bindingResult - Holds the results of the validation of the DrugUpdateDTO. This allows for checking if the data is valid before proceeding.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a GenericMessageResponseDTO that indicated whether the drug was successfully updated or if an error occurred.

    • removeDrug

      @DeleteMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GenericMessageResponseDTO> removeDrug(@RequestHeader(name="Authorization") String authorization, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid DrugDeletionDTO drugDeletionDTO, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
      Processes the HTTP request to delete an existing drug in the system. Validates drug data, and removes it from the database.
      Parameters:
      authorization - The authorization token used to identify user making the request.
      drugDeletionDTO - DTO containing the details of the drug to be removed.
      bindingResult - Holds the results of the validation of the DrugDeletionDTO. This allows for checking if the data is valid before proceeding.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a GenericMessageResponseDTO that indicated whether the drug was successfully deleted or if an error occurred.

    • getDrugs

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<DrugFetchListDTO> getDrugs(@RequestHeader(name="Authorization") String authorization)
      Fetches a list of drugs from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      authorization - The authorization token used to identify user making the request.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a DrugFetchListDTO with a list of drugs. Only sends necessary information contained in DrugFormDTO.
